name: Samsung.

name: Google LLC
description: An American multinational technology company specializing in Internet-related services and products.

children.name: Google Search
children.description: A web search engine developed by Google. It is the most-used search engine on the World Wide Web.

children.name: Image Search
children.description: Search for images on the web.

children.name: News Search
children.description: Search for news articles on the web.

children.name: Android
children.description: A mobile operating system based on a modified version of the Linux kernel and other open source software.

children.name: Android 12
children.description: The twelfth major release and the 19th version of Android.

children.name: Android 13
children.description: The thirteenth major release of the Android mobile operating system.

children.name: YouTube
children.description: An online video-sharing platform headquartered in San Bruno, California.

children.name: Google Cloud
children.description: A suite of cloud computing services that runs on the same infrastructure that Google uses internally for its end-user products.

name: Microsoft Corporation
description: An American multinational technology company with headquarters in Redmond, Washington.

children.name: Windows
children.description: A group of several proprietary graphical operating system families developed and marketed by Microsoft.

children.name: Windows 10
children.description: The latest version of Microsoft's operating system for personal computers.

children.name: Windows 11
children.description: The next major version of Microsoft's operating system for personal computers.

children.name: Office 365
children.description: A line of subscription services offered by Microsoft as part of the Microsoft Office product line.

children.name: Word
children.description: A word processing software developed by Microsoft.

children.name: Excel
children.description: A spreadsheet developed by Microsoft.

children.name: Azure
children.description: A cloud computing service created by Microsoft for building, testing, deploying, and managing applications and services.

children.name: Xbox
children.description: A video gaming brand created and owned by Microsoft.

children.name: Xbox Series X
children.description: The latest gaming console from Microsoft.

children.name: Xbox Series S
children.description: A lower-cost alternative to the Xbox Series X.

name: Amazon.com, Inc.
description: An American multinational technology company based in Seattle, Washington, which focuses on e-commerce, cloud computing, digital streaming, and artificial intelligence.

children.name: Amazon Prime
children.description: A paid subscription service that offers its users access to services that would otherwise be unavailable or cost extra to the typical Amazon customer.

children.name: Prime Video
children.description: An Internet video on demand service that is developed, owned, and operated by Amazon.

children.name: Prime Music
children.description: A music streaming service similar to Spotify and Apple Music.

children.name: Amazon Web Services
children.description: A subsidiary of Amazon providing on-demand cloud computing platforms and APIs to individuals, companies, and governments.

children.name: Kindle
children.description: A series of e-readers designed and marketed by Amazon.

children.name: Kindle Paperwhite
children.description: A mid-range e-reader with a high-resolution display and built-in light.

children.name: Kindle Oasis
children.description: A high-end e-reader with a larger screen and more features.

children.name: Alexa
children.description: A virtual assistant AI developed by Amazon, first used in the Amazon Echo smart speakers.
